title: How to Make Chocolate Caramallows

steps.headline: Prepare all items.
steps.description: Above and below are items/ingredients that will be needed at some point during making this treat. Make sure all is gathered/set out before you begin.

steps.headline: Line a pan.
steps.description: Using parchment paper line a 10x10 pan with parchment paper so that it covers all sides.

steps.headline: Grease the pan.
steps.description: Using a nonstick agent, grease the pan. (For example, butter, PAM, spray, etc.)

steps.headline: Prepare the butter.
steps.description: Place 1/4 cup of unsalted butter in a bowl (microwave safe) and microwave for 10-15 or just long enough to soften it.

steps.headline: Stir in the sugars.
steps.description: Stir in all of the sugars, corn syrup, and milk into the same bowl as the butter.

steps.headline: Microwave the mix.
steps.description: Microwave the candy mix for two minutes.

steps.headline: Pour.
steps.description: Stir once more and pour into the pan prepared earlier. Tap/lightly shake pan until the hot candy is level against all sides.

steps.headline: Set aside.
steps.description: Set aside the pan to cool for one whole hour, use the parchment paper to pick up and let it cool for another whole hour.

steps.headline: Cut the caramel.
steps.description: Using a knife, cut the candy mixture into squares. (1.5x1.5 if you want an exact measurement.)

steps.headline: Line.
steps.description: Line another baking sheet with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Form the Caramallows.
steps.description: To do this place a mini marshmallow in the center of each of the squares of caramel you cut.

steps.headline: Bring the top and bottom corners together.
Fold right and left toward the center.
Pick up and roll the candy into a smooth ball.
Press flat with your hands to form a ´patty´.
steps.description: Place each one on a baking sheet.

steps.headline: Keep the treat in the fridge or freezer for 30 minutes, to make them easier to handle.
Using a dipping fork, or tongs dip each square in the melted chocolate.
Keep these in the fridge on the same baking sheet for 10 minutes until the chocolate is hardened.
steps.description: Best ate at room temperature when finally done!

sentences: Preparation Prepare all items.
Above and below are items/ingredients that will be needed at some point during making this treat.
Make sure all is gathered/set out before you begin.
Line a pan.
Using parchment paper line a 10x10 pan with parchment paper so that it covers all sides.
Grease the pan.
Using a nonstick agent, grease the pan.
(For example, butter, PAM, spray, etc.)
Cooking Prepare the butter.
Place 1/4 cup of unsalted butter in a bowl (microwave safe) and microwave for 10-15 or just long enough to soften it.
Stir in the sugars.
Stir in all of the sugars, corn syrup, and milk into the same bowl as the butter.
Microwave the mix.
Microwave the candy mix for two minutes.
Pour.
Stir once more and pour into the pan prepared earlier.
Tap/lightly shake pan until the hot candy is level against all sides.
Set aside.
Set aside the pan to cool for one whole hour, use the parchment paper to pick up and let it cool for another whole hour.
Cut the caramel.
Using a knife, cut the candy mixture into squares.
(1.5x1.5 if you want an exact measurement.)
Line.
Line another baking sheet with parchment paper.
Form the Caramallows.
To do this place a mini marshmallow in the center of each of the squares of caramel you cut.
Bring the top and bottom corners together.
Fold right and left toward the center.
Pick up and roll the candy into a smooth ball.
Press flat with your hands to form a ´patty´.
Place each one on a baking sheet.
Keep the treat in the fridge or freezer for 30 minutes, to make them easier to handle.
Using a dipping fork, or tongs dip each square in the melted chocolate.
Keep these in the fridge on the same baking sheet for 10 minutes until the chocolate is hardened.
Best ate at room temperature when finally done!
Finished.
